solution_line_template: The cost of {num_ice_cream_cones} cones of ice cream was {num_ice_cream_cones} * ${cost_per_ice_cream_cone} = $<<{num_ice_cream_cones}*{cost_per_ice_cream_cone}={total_cost_ice_cream}>>{total_cost_ice_cream}.
The cost of the {num_pudding_cups} cups of pudding was {num_pudding_cups} * ${cost_per_pudding_cup} = $<<{num_pudding_cups}*{cost_per_pudding_cup}={total_cost_pudding}>>{total_cost_pudding}.
Jane spent ${total_cost_ice_cream} - ${total_cost_pudding} = $<<{total_cost_ice_cream}-{total_cost_pudding}={difference_in_spending}>>{difference_in_spending} more on ice cream than on pudding.
